graphdata



enum GraphMode;
Graph modes.

Sum
Show totals per time unit.

Average
Show averages over measurements (e.g. frames).

class GraphData;
Stores graph data accumulating over time.

this(string[] graph_names...);
Construct graph data with specified names of measured values.

Params:
string[] graph_names Names of measured values.

void die();
Destroy this GraphData.

final void mode(GraphMode mode);
Set graph mode, i.e. should data points be sums or averages?

final real time_resolution();
Get time resolution of the graph.

final real start_time();
Get time when this graph started to exist.

final string[] graph_names();
Get names of values measured.

final void update_value(string name, real value);
Add a value to the graph for value with specified name.

real[] data_points(string name, real start, real end, real period);
Accumulate recorded values to data points, one point per period specified, each data point being an sum or average of values over that period, depending on graph mode. Return data points between times specified by start and end.

Params:
string name Name of the value to get data points for.
real start Start time to take data points from.
real end End time to take data points until.
real period Time period to represent by single data point.

Returns:
Resulting array of data points.

bool empty(string name);
Determine if graph of value with specified name is empty.

Note that the graph is empty for a while until first value accumulates value is added, which depends on time resolution.

Params:
string name Name of the value to check.

Returns:
true if the graph is empty, false otherwise.

real delay(string name);
Get delay of graph of value with specified name relative to this GraphData.

Params:
string name Name of the value to check.

Returns:
Delay of the graph relative to this GraphData in seconds.

void update();
Update graph data memory representation.
